page.title: 20Slurry Dams - New.
page.content: At the top of Coombs Dale in an area called Blakeden Hollow, and south of what was Black Harry Farm, a dam has been constructed to contain slurry, waste left from fluorspar processing at Cavendish Mill. The dam was allowed on appeal to the Secretary of State for the Environment. The dam that was built is by Black HarryGate and provides for the enclosure of slurry up to about the 315 m contour. Just over half the slurry area of 30 hectares comes within this block. The centre point of the slurry area is at about 201743.
